intro: Pleurospermum isetense, commonly known as the mountain everlasting, is a flowering plant native to the high altitudes of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads and medicinal properties. The plant typically grows in rocky and arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its yellow flowers bloom in summer, adding a vibrant touch to alpine landscapes. Due to its resilience and ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and used in traditional medicine.
